body.p: An investor can have power even if it holds less than a majority of the voting rights of an investee. An investor can have power with less than a majority of the voting rights of an investee, for example, through:

li.p: a contractual arrangement between the investor and other vote holders (see paragraph B39);
rights arising from other contractual arrangements (see paragraph B40);
the investor’s voting rights (see paragraphs B41–B45);
potential voting rights (see paragraphs B47–B50); or
